trans-unit.source: The java.sql.DatabaseMetaData.getBestRowIdentifier method looks for identifiers in a specific order. This order might not return a unique row.

seg-source.mrk: The java.sql.DatabaseMetaData.getBestRowIdentifier method looks for identifiers in a specific order.
This order might not return a unique row.

target.mrk: The java.sql.DatabaseMetaData.getBestRowIdentifier method looks for identifiers in a specific order.
This order might not return a unique row.

trans-unit.source: The java.sql.DatabaseMetaData.getBestRowIdentifier method looks for identifiers in the following order:

seg-source.mrk: The java.sql.DatabaseMetaData.getBestRowIdentifier method looks for identifiers in the following order:

target.mrk: The java.sql.DatabaseMetaData.getBestRowIdentifier method looks for identifiers in the following order:

trans-unit.source: A primary key on the table

seg-source.mrk: A primary key on the table

target.mrk: A primary key on the table

trans-unit.source: A unique constraint or unique index on the table

seg-source.mrk: A unique constraint or unique index on the table

target.mrk: A unique constraint or unique index on the table

trans-unit.source: All of the columns in the table

seg-source.mrk: All of the columns in the table

target.mrk: All of the columns in the table

trans-unit.source: If the java.sql.DatabaseMetaData.getBestRowIdentifier method does not find a primary key, unique constraint, or unique index, the method must look for identifiers in all of the columns in the table. When the method looks for identifiers this way, the method will always find a set of columns that identify a row. However, a unique row might not be identified if there are duplicate rows in the table.

seg-source.mrk: If the java.sql.DatabaseMetaData.getBestRowIdentifier method does not find a primary key, unique constraint, or unique index, the method must look for identifiers in all of the columns in the table.
When the method looks for identifiers this way, the method will always find a set of columns that identify a row.
However, a unique row might not be identified if there are duplicate rows in the table.

target.mrk: If the java.sql.DatabaseMetaData.getBestRowIdentifier method does not find a primary key, unique constraint, or unique index, the method must look for identifiers in all of the columns in the table.
When the method looks for identifiers this way, the method will always find a set of columns that identify a row.
However, a unique row might not be identified if there are duplicate rows in the table.
